resources.string: You did not use the following questions

string-array.name: trialQuestion1
string-array.item: Which of the following are given the title of Pharaoh?
Who is left his invasions unfinished because of the disease.
Whose teacher was the Greek philosopher Aristotle.

string-array.name: animalsQuestion1
string-array.item: The name of which islands below means “Islands of the Dogs”?

string-array.name: animalsQuestion2
string-array.item: What does a penguin in love give to the female to propose to her?
Which of the following has an inorganic compound?

string-array.name: animalsQuestion3
string-array.item: Which animal sees what’s going on behind it without turning its head?
Seeing a predator that animal can die of fear.
Which of the following animals can jump 7 times higher than its height?

string-array.name: animalsQuestion4
string-array.item: Which piece is replaced by a dog in the Mongolian chess?
At the beginning of the match there are 2 of these pieces on the chessboard.
In classic chess this piece can place up to 27 fields under threat.

string-array.name: animalsQuestion5
string-array.item: The length of which animal’s tongue is equal to its body length?

Which animal is able to change its skin colour?

string-array.name: animalsQuestion6
string-array.item: Which animal did the Egyptian goddess of fertility Heqet resemble?
Which animal has a statue in France for its service to science?
As a rule, that animal does not walk.

string-array.name: animalsQuestion7
string-array.item: Who helps the crocodile to clean the teeth?
Whose body temperature is higher than the human?
Whose body coverage is used in pillows?

string-array.name: animalsQuestion8
string-array.item: Which is the only predator that has 5 fingers?
Which animal spends the winter sleeping?
Which animal is more often a toy?

string-array.name: animalsQuestion9
string-array.item: Alectryomancy is an old form of divination with the help of one of the following animals.
Which animal is the symbol of France?
Which animal can substitute the alarm clock?

string-array.name: animalsQuestion10
string-array.item: Which of the following can fish scales help to identify?
Which of the following can the lines on a tree trunk section identify?

string-array.name: animalsQuestion11
string-array.item: what animal is planting more trees throughout the year

resources.string: You passed at school the most part of this questions

string-array.name: schoolQuestion1
string-array.item: Which capital is situated on an island?
In 2013 the British magazine Monocle recognized this city as the most comfortable for living.
Which Danish city is the statue of The Little Mermaid located in?

string-array.name: schoolQuestion2
string-array.item: Who of the following was given the title of Pharaoh?
Who left his invasions unfinished because of a disease?
Whose teacher was the Greek philosopher Aristotle?

string-array.name: schoolQuestion3
string-array.item: Which planet is the closest to the Earth?
The Goddess of love and beauty in the Roman mythology.
The sun rises in the west on that planet.

string-array.name: schoolQuestion4
string-array.item: Which country did fascism originate in?
Where do Amerigo Vespucci, Galileo Galilei and Leonardo da Vinci come from?
A country, which resembles a heeled boot on the map.

string-array.name: schoolQuestion5
string-array.item: Which country were the Arabic numerals invented in?
When Christopher Columbus first set foot on the American Continent he thought it was that country.
That country has more than 1 billion inhabitants.

string-array.name: schoolQuestion6
string-array.item: Which animal has the highest blood pressure?
Which of the following animals runs the fastest?
The group that animals is called a tower in English.

string-array.name: schoolQuestion7
string-array.item: How many colours does the flag of Libyan Arab Jamahiriya have?
How many even prime numbers are there?
Which place must a sportsman take to become a champion?

string-array.name: schoolQuestion8
string-array.item: What is the name of the first cervical vertebra which hold the head?
A powerful titan in the Greek mythology who supported the weight of the world on his shoulders.
One of the oceans bears the same name.

string-array.name: schoolQuestion9
string-array.item: Whose life has not been crucially affected by an apple?
Catholic Church of Rome arrested him accusing him of being a heretic for his work which proved that the earth revolves around the sun.

string-array.name: schoolQuestion10
string-array.item: The capitulation of which country did World War II end with?
Which country was the nuclear weapon used against?
The territory of that country consists of 6852 islands.

string-array.name: schoolQuestion11
string-array.item: Which metal is the era BC 4000-3000 named after?
Which metal are wind instruments made of?
Which is the main component of bronze?

string-array.name: schoolQuestion12
string-array.item: How many thermal zones are there?
How many times should paper be folded to have 32 layers?

string-array.name: schoolQuestion13
string-array.item: Which place has the largest territory?

string-array.name: schoolQuestion14
string-array.item: Which arithmetic operation should substitute * so as 0.3*0.2 gets the greatest value?
In which case can the result of two integers be rational?
Which arithmetic operation is impossible if one of the components is 0?

string-array.name: schoolQuestion15
string-array.item: In ancient times people believed that those animals supported the world on them.
That animal can stay awake for 3 months, and while asleep it can be drowned in water.
